headline: What Catalysts Are Recasting The Nucor (NUE) Story On Pricing Tariffs And Valuation
summary: Nucor’s latest valuation work has nudged fair value to $186.08 from $182.38, with the discount rate moving to 8.53% from 8.54% and long term revenue growth now modeled at 5.12% instead of 4.69%. This shift lines up with recent Street commentary that blends confidence in steel pricing, tariffs and domestic share gains with caution that the current share price already embeds a strong outlook. Stay tuned as we break down what is driving this changing narrative and how you can keep on top of...

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Nucor (NUE) After Strong Multi Year Share Price Gains
summary: If you are wondering whether Nucor's share price still offers value at current levels, this article will walk through what the numbers say about where the stock stands today. Nucor's share price most recently closed at US$194.42, with total returns of 2.4% over 7 days, 17.1% over 30 days, 14.8% year to date, 48.0% over 1 year, 19.4% over 3 years, and 268.7% over 5 years. Recent moves in the stock have come alongside ongoing interest in US steel and materials companies and how they might fit...

headline: Could Cramer’s Praise Refocus Nucor’s (NUE) Investment Narrative Around Durable Competitive Strength?
summary: On 11 February 2026, Jim Cramer highlighted Cleveland-Cliffs as pressured by tariffs while praising Nucor as the stronger steel operator and suggesting investors consider Nucor on weakness. This endorsement positions Nucor as a perceived quality leader in the steel space, potentially reinforcing investor confidence in its operating model versus key peers. Next, we’ll explore how this endorsement of Nucor as the superior steel operator may influence its existing investment narrative. Find 52...
